question: In the reaction <katex>$CH_{3}-CH=CH-CH_{2}OH \xrightarrow{PCC} CH_{3}-CH=CH-CHO$</katex>, hybridisation change involved at C-1 is:
explanation: The carbon in the alcohol group (<katex>$-CH_2OH$</katex>) is <katex>$sp^3$</katex> hybridized. In the aldehyde group (<katex>$-CHO$</katex>), it becomes <katex>$sp^2$</katex> hybridized.
